intro: Senecio mixtus, commonly known as the Mixed Groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by fluffy, seed-filled capsules. Senecio mixtus is generally hardy and drought-tolerant, making it a resilient plant in arid environments.
